original_title: Sampath Group’s total assets surpassed Rs 2 Tn
original_body_lines: Sampath Bank has posted a robust financial performance for the first half of 2025, recording a Profit Before Tax (PBT) of Rs 24.4 billion and a Profit After Tax (PAT) of Rs 14.7 billion, reflecting a 32% year-on-year growth. The Sampath Group also reported a 32% rise in both PBT and PAT, reaching Rs 26.0 billion and Rs 15.6 billion, respectively.

Despite a 6% decline in net interest income to Rs 38.6 billion—due to lower interest rates and reduced yields from government securities—the Bank’s non-fund based income surged by 122% to Rs 15.9 billion. This included a notable exchange gain of Rs 2.4 billion, reversing a Rs 2.7 billion loss in the prior year.

Impairment charges saw a sharp 78% drop to Rs 1.4 billion, driven by improved credit quality and prudent risk management. Operating expenses rose by 20%, largely due to higher personnel costs, pushing the cost-to-income ratio up to 39.9% from 37.5% in 2024.

Sampath Bank’s asset base expanded by 8.4% to Rs 1.93 trillion, with the gross loan portfolio surpassing Rs 1 trillion for the first time. The Bank also saw growth in its deposit base, which rose to Rs 1.61 trillion, supported by improved CASA performance. Group total assets crossed the Rs 2 trillion mark.

Key capital ratios remained strong, well above regulatory requirements, despite the bank’s designation as a Domestic Systemically Important Bank (D-SIB). Liquidity also remained healthy, with an LCR of 312.1% and an NSFR of 198.6%.

Reinforcing its ESG leadership, Sampath Bank launched several sustainability initiatives, including coral reef conservation, mangrove regeneration, and a women’s startup program. The Bank enhanced ESG-linked credit screening and aligned disclosures with global frameworks, earning recognition as “Best Bank for ESG in Sri Lanka” at the Euromoney Awards 2025.
Sampath Bank continues to play a pivotal role in Sri Lanka’s recovery, supporting businesses and communities through targeted financial and sustainability programs.
